docs.title: Welcome to Cit's docs!
docs.text:
cit is a centralized script runner for Unix. It's main features are:

  • Scaffolding templates
  • Running scripts
  • Opening repositories

And much else: it's easily extensible and customizable.

Let's cit install it!

docs.title: Commands
docs.text: Cit ships with many useful commands. See the customization page for how to easily add your own.

docs.title: Scaffolding
docs.text: Command Description cit scaffold python my-pkg "Description of My package" Scaffold a Python package cit scaffold typescript my-ts-pkg Scaffold a TypeScript package cit scaffold react my-spa Scaffold a React x Vite x ChakraUI SPA cit scaffold next my-next-app Scaffold a Next.js x Tailwind app cit scaffold capacitor my-cap-app Scaffold a Capacitor x React x Vite app

docs.title: Running scripts, service, containers, etc.
docs.text: Command Description cit run postgres Run a PostgreSQL container cit kill postgres Kill the PostgreSQL container cit run redis Run a Redis container cit kill redis Kill the Redis container cit run rabbitmq Run a RabbitMQ container cit kill rabbitmq Kill the RabbitMQ container

docs.title: Opening repositories
docs.text:
Command Description cit open cit Open the cit repository cit open <my-repo> You can customize this!

Now, let's customize it!

docs.title: Understanding Cit
docs.text:
The cit repo has this structure:

cit/
  ...
  commands/
    cit.just
    scaffold.just
    open.just
    run.just
    ...

The cit command is an alias to

just -f $CIT_HOME/commands/cit.just

The main cit.just imports other .just files as submodules. Check out just to learn more about it!

docs.title: Adding a new subcommand
docs.text:
We want to add:

cit <command> <new-subcommand> # e.g. cit run kafka

We'll have to add a new rule to commands/<command>.just:

# commands/run.just

kafka:
  docker run --rm -d --name kafka -p 9092:9092 apache/kafka:latest

docs.title: Adding a new command
docs.text:
We want to add:

cit <new-command> # e.g. cit say

We'll have to add a new .just file (a Just module) to commands/:

# commands/say.just

hello:
  @echo Hello

bye:
  @echo Bye

And then we'll have to import it in commands/cit.just:

# commands/cit.just
mod say

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Install just

  2. Clone the repo: 

    git clone https://github.com/marciclabas/cit.git

  3. Source the cit script in .bashrc (or .zshrc, etc.): 

    # .bashrc
source /path/to/cit/source.sh

Let's cit run some commands!
